meanings.definition: A rope or line used for measuring or as a boundary marker.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a lyme to measure the length of the field.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker tied a lyme around the area to mark where the building would be.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy mistook the lyme for a toy and started playing tug-of-war with it.
meanings.sent4: The lyme of friendship bound them together tightly, never letting go.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow lyme stood out against the green grass, guiding the way.

meanings.definition: A medieval unit of distance equal to about 1/10 of a league.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, travelers would measure their journey in lymes.
meanings.sent2: The knight rode on horseback for several lymes before reaching the castle.
meanings.sent3: The baker mistakenly used a lyme instead of a foot to measure the dough.
meanings.sent4: The lyme of time seemed to stretch endlessly in the vast desert.
meanings.sent5: The lyme marked on the map indicated a short distance to the next village.

meanings.definition: A type of bacterial infection transmitted by ticks.
meanings.sent1: After camping in the woods, she developed lyme from a tick bite.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with lyme after recognizing the symptoms.
meanings.sent3: The lyme bacteria threw a party in the body, causing chaos and discomfort.
meanings.sent4: The lyme spread through the community like wildfire, affecting many people.
meanings.sent5: The tiny tick carried the dangerous lyme, unknowingly passing it to its host.
